intro: Koanophyllon huantae, commonly known as the Huanta grass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Koanophyllon huantae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insect species.
